Search Home City Departments Recreation & Cultural Arts Arts & Culture Pembroke Pines Art & Cultural Center Pembroke Pines Art & Cultural Center The Pembroke Pines Art and Cultural Center is located at 901 NW 129 th Avenue. We offer music, art and drama classes. Open enrollment & Facility Tours going on now. UPCOMING CLASSES/WORKSHOPS National Arts in Education Week The City of Pembroke Pines celebrates National Arts in Education Week, September 14 - 20, 2025! Friday 9/15 Art Garden  – Create paper flowers at Pembroke Pines Art and Cultural Center, 4-6pm . Join us in this FREE drop-in art activity and learn how to make paper flowers! Participants will be able to take their paper flowers home and contribute one flower to our "Art Garden" display. All supplies will be provided. No registration required , just show up! See full Flyer here! about undefined about undefined about undefined about undefined Piano and Art Lessons The City of Pembroke Pines offers affordable afterschool Art & Piano Classes for children ages 5-17 throughout the week! To get started, we will need your driver's license and your child's birth certificate. Contact Cultural Arts Coordinator, Aleyah Alli, for further assistance at aalli@ppines.com or call              954-743-1799! For access to our catalog, visit https://secure.rec1.com/FL/pembroke-pines-fl/catalog Registration for September Classes begin JULY 1! ** Thursday Teen Art Classes begin in September.** Note: The increase in class prices is in effect for October classes, onward. ¿Necesitas nuestra información en español? ¡Haga clic aquí! about undefined  about undefined  about undefined about undefined about undefined about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined about undefined about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined  about undefined Para acceder a nuestro catálogo, haga clic aquí: https://secure.rec1.com/FL/pembroke-pines-fl/catalog La inscripcion para las clases de Septiembre comienza el 1 de JULIO! **Las clases de los jueves para adolescentes comienzan en Septiembre.** Nota: El aumento en los precios de las clases esta vigente para las classes de Octubre en adelante. City Of Pembroke Pines Art and Cultural Center Facebook Twitter Linkedin Print City Of Pembroke Pines Art and Cultural Center The New Pembroke Pines Art and Cultural Center , located at 901 NW 129 th Avenue, will be opening this fall. The new center will offer music, art and drama classes.  Open enrollment & Facility Tours begin Saturday, September 4th.  For more information, please contact Lisa Worley, Recreation Specialist at 954-986-5027.  Classes to start in October 2021. The New Pembroke Pines Art and Cultural Center , located at 901 NW 129 th Avenue, will be opening this fall. The new center will offer music, art and drama classes.  Open enrollment & Facility Tours begin Saturday, September 4th.  For more information, please contact Lisa Worley, Recreation Specialist at 954-986-5027.  Classes to start in October 2021. Search Home City Departments Office of Communications Office of Communications Everyone - residents and businesses alike - plays a valuable role in making Pembroke Pines a special place to live, work and play. Through our digital city newspaper and newsletter, digital signage, city television programming and social media on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter (X), LinkedIn and Next Door ( Social Media Policy Terms of Use about undefined  about undefined ), it's easy to keep in touch with what is happening throughout the City. Please note: Under Florida law, all content on the city's Social Media pages are subject to the public records law, Chapter 119, Florida Statutes . By becoming a fan of these pages, posting comments or messaging these pages, your information will be a matter of public record. The City of Pembroke Pines Public Communications Plan about undefined about undefined  about undefined  about undefined about undefined Discover all that we have to offer in Pembroke Pines - the big city with the hometown feel. Be sure to know what is happening in Pembroke Pines by reading City Connect, a digital newspaper published by the City of Pembroke Pines 6x a year for all residents and businesses. It's located on the City's website in both English and Spanish. City Connect shines a spotlight on activities, events and local issues in your own backyard. We're here for you, Pembroke Pines! City Connect Newsflash digital newsletter by the City of Pembroke Pines lets you know what's happening throughout the city in an easy digital format received via email. In our continuing effort to find new ways to communicate with residents, we believe these emails will be informative and useful. Please help us make it the best that it can be by sharing it with your family, friends, and neighbors. We hope you enjoy all upcoming emails which will feature important alerts, special event info, and so much more quickly and effectively. Please subscribe HERE To read past issues of Newsflash, please click below to the date desired. 2025 September 3, 2025 August 13, 2025 July 3, 2025 July 23, 2025 June 12, 2025 May 16, 2025 April 17, 2025 March 13, 2025 February 26, 2025 January 31, 2025 UPDATE January 30, 2025 2024 December 10, 2024 November 19, 2024 November 14, 2024 November 7, 2024 October 16, 2024 September 12, 2024 August 15, 2024 July 11, 2024 June 5, 2024 June 26, 2024 May 15, 2024 May 1, 2024 April 17, 2024 April 3, 2024 March 20, 2024 March 6, 2024 February 7, 2024 February 21, 2024 January 17, 2024 January 3, 2024 2023 HAPPY NEW YEAR There is more... Website Sign In City Government City Departments Business Opportunities Resident Resources How Do I…? Search Home City Departments Recreation & Cultural Arts Recreation & Cultural Arts Purpose The City of Pembroke Pines Recreation and Cultural Arts Department is committed to enhancing the quality of life for our residents by offering a diverse and inclusive range of leisure and recreational programs. Our purpose is to provide enriching activities, engaging events, and well-maintained facilities that support community connection, personal well-being, and lifelong enjoyment. Know Before You Go: Park Updates & Closures Playground at Ashley Hale Park (NW 106 Terr & NW118 Place)  is closed until further notice due to protected owls in the area. We apologize for the inconvenienc e and thank you for your continued support. Dogs are not permitted in City parks except for the Craig Rupp K-9 Park and Steven L. Josias Dog Park. Studio 18 Classes For Immediate Release Media Contact: Brian Spector 954-392-2082 bspector@ppines.com Pembroke Pines, FL (August 1, 2018) – Studio 18 in the Pines features a wide array of art classes and events. Put your creativity to the test and meet more people by attending the classes listed below. For additional information about Studio 18 in the Pines, please call 954.961.6067, visit www.ppines.com/studio18 or contact Amelia Mohamed at amohamed@ppines.com. Coffee & Create Unlimited Coffee…that’s right!  Come enjoy endless amounts of coffee, create a work of art and make new friends at the Coffee & Create class on Wednesday, October 10 th from 10 a.m. – 12 p.m. at Studio 18 in the Pines located at 1101 Poinciana Drive in Pembroke Pines.  Cost is $10 per student and materials are included. Registration begins on September 1 st and concludes on October 8 th .  Participants must be at least 18 years of age to take part and space is limited.  For more information, please call Amelia Mohamed at (954) 961-6067 Mosaic Tile with Alicia Let your passion run wild and produce mosaic art with Alicia.  As a student in this class you will cut glass and ceramics to create mosaic art. This art class is designed for both beginners and intermediate students.  Classes are limited to 10 students to allow maximum instructor/ student interaction in a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere.  Classes are offered on Tuesdays from 10:00 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. at Studio 18 in the Pines located at 1101 Poinciana Drive in Pembroke Pines.  The fee is $100 for Pembroke Pines residents, which includes 4 classes, with a $20 material fee.  Non-Residents of Pembroke Pines pay a fee of $125.  For additional information, please contact Alicia Rodriguez at (786) 543-2439 or aliciainmiami@hotmail.com. Life Drawing The Life Drawing class is held on the last Thursday of every month from 7 p.m.– 9 p.m. at Studio 18 in the Pines, located at 1101 Poinciana Drive in Pembroke Pines.  This is your opportunity to create your own art inspired by a live model.  A drawing board and easel is provided to you.  Don’t miss out on the Life Drawing Class.  No previous art experience is required.  The cost is $15 per person.  For further information, please call (954) 961-6067. Mixed Media & Visual Art Use your imagination and learn contemporary art on Tuesdays from 3:30 p.m. – 5:00 p.m. and Saturdays from 12:30 p.m. – 2:30 p.m.  These classes will begin with an introduction to the history of contemporary art.  Each student will design a piece of artwork incorporating the concepts and techniques discussed in class.  Classes are limited to 12 students.  Pembroke Pines residents pay a $100 class fee with an additional $20 material fee.  $125 for non-residents of Pembroke Pines with the same $20 material fee.  To schedule classes and for further information, please contact Marielle Plaisir at (786) 719-3175 or marielle.plaisir.art@gmail.com. Introduction to Oil Painting Learn to Oil Paint on Tuesdays or Saturdays at Studio 18 in the Pines from 10 a.m. –12:30 p.m.  The Mona Lisa is the most popular, visited and famous work of art in the entire world.  The Mona Lisa is an oil painting…perhaps you can produce the next!  No previous art experience is necessary.  The cost is $100 per person plus a $10 material fee for Pembroke Pines residents and $125 with the same $10 material fee for non-residents.  For additional information or to register, please contact Maria Wieder at mwsmiles3@aol.com or call (954) 649-4053. Search Home City Departments Recreation & Cultural Arts Arts & Culture Studio 18 Art Complex Current Exhibitions Current Exhibitions Step into a world of vivid color and textured emotion as the Palette Knife Artists of Miami bring Florida’s wild beauty to life—one bold stroke at a time. Born of Earth and Sky features powerful paintings of mangroves, coral reefs (both thriving and bleached), birds, turtles, and butterflies—capturing the delicate balance of ecosystems we depend on. Through the expressive technique of palette knife painting, this exhibition blends art and advocacy, inviting viewers to connect with nature and reflect on what’s at risk in a rapidly changing climate. Don’t miss this immersive celebration of creativity, community, and environmental care. On view from August 15 through October 30. City Manager's Office | Pembroke Pines, FL - Official Website Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In City Government City Departments Business Opportunities Resident Resources How Do I…? Search Home City Government City Manager's Office City Manager's Office City Manager Charles F. Dodge A municipal employee of the City of Pembroke Pines for nearly 50 years, Charles F. Dodge was appointed City Manager in 1989, at a time when the community not only began to double in population, but there was also an increase in demand for roads, parks, public safety and schools. Today, under his management, the City has grown to be Florida’s tenth largest municipality, with over 170,000 residents, and home to the largest municipally-owned Charter School System in Broward County. Mr. Dodge was hired by the City of Pembroke Pines in 1975 as the City’s first Community Services Director. Under his direction, the first senior citizen center in Broward County was opened in Pembroke Pines. It was also his vision that advanced the development of the City’s 50,000-square-foot Senior Complex which also includes residential apartments for senior citizens. He has held several department director positions, including Director of Code Enforcement, City Clerk, and Assistant City Manager. In 1998, Mr. Dodge opened the City’s Charter Schools, a school system with four elementary, two middle, and one high school, with a total student population of more than 5,900. Background Originally from Worcester, Massachusetts, Mr. Dodge has been a resident of Broward County since 1972. He received a Bachelor of Arts degree from St. Vincent de Paul Seminary in Boynton Beach, FL. He is married with four children and three grandchildren. Mr. Dodge is the recipient of numerous awards, and a member of various professional and community organizations. Contact Us Charles F. Dodge City Center , Pembroke Pines FL Nov 02 - 03 2024 The City of Pembroke Pines invites you to the 26th Annual Art & Music Fest in the Pines held at the Charles F. Dodge City Center, 601 City Center Way, on Saturday, November 2 from 11AM to 8 PM and Sunday, November 3, from 12PM to 5PM. The City of Pembroke Pines Recreation and Cultural Arts Department will be hosting the 26th Annual Art & Music Fest in the Pines on Saturday, November 2nd, from 11 AM to 8 PM and Sunday, November 3rd from 12 to 5 PM at the Charles F. Dodge City Center . This family-friendly event is FREE and will feature live music by Bryant Del Toro Band, Joey Calderaio Band and a throwback to the 70s and 80s with The Rock Show . Enjoy free workshops at The Frank Art Gallery, curated art vendors, interactive ... view more » The City of Pembroke Pines Recreation and Cultural Arts Department will be hosting the 26th Annual Art & Music Fest in the Pines on Saturday, November 2nd, from 11 AM to 8 PM and Sunday, November 3rd from 12 to 5 PM at the Charles F. Dodge City Center . This family-friendly event is FREE and will feature live music by Bryant Del Toro Band, Joey Calderaio Band and a throwback to the 70s and 80s with The Rock Show . Enjoy free workshops at The Frank Art Gallery, curated art vendors, interactive performances, food trucks, a student art competition, and a kid’s zone. For more information about the event, please call 954-392-2122. This event was made possible through the official sponsorship of Jacobs. Thank you to our sponsors!
